sentences.en: Better to die in glory than live in dishonour.
Death was considered vastly preferable to dishonour.
Do not blacken your fame, and perish in dishonour!
sentences.cn: 不要玷污你的名声, 不光彩地毁掉自己!

sentences.en: Don't you dishonour their memories by pretending you didn't know!
sentences.cn: 你别装作不知情而令他们蒙羞!

sentences.en: He dishonored the uniform and did not deserve to be a marine.
sentences.cn: 他玷污了这身军服，不配当一名海军陆战队士兵。

sentences.en: He would rather die than live in dishonour.
I dare not quit my post, though an unfaithful sentinel, whose sure reward is death and dishonour, when his dreary watch shall come to an end!
sentences.cn: 虽说我是个不忠于职守的哨兵，等到这种沉网的守望终了的时候，我所能得到的报酬只能是不光彩的死亡，但我仍不敢擅离岗位！

sentences.en: It is illegal to dishonour bookings; that goes for restaurants as well as customers.
sentences.cn: 不履行预订是违法行为，这既适用于餐馆和也适用于顾客。

sentences.en: It is sown in dishonour. It is raised in glory.
sentences.cn: 所种的是羞辱的, 复活的是荣耀的.

sentences.en: It was as if she felt on her lips the taste of dishonour.
sentences.cn: 她的嘴唇仿佛尝到了耻辱的滋味.

sentences.en: It would dishonour my family if I didn't wear the veil.
sentences.cn: 如果我不戴面纱就会有辱门楣。

sentences.en: She felt herself shut in with her dishonour.
sentences.cn: 她觉得自己被锁在里面,已彻底地身败名裂.

sentences.en: Stealing reflects dishonour on your family.
sentences.cn: 偷窃行为会使家人蒙羞.

sentences.en: When this happens, they will dishonour their own promises.
sentences.cn: 如果这件事发生, 他们将会不履行诺言.

sentences.en: You’ve brought enough dishonour on your family already without causing any more trouble.
sentences.cn: 你惹的麻烦已经让你的家人够丢脸的了，不用再添乱了。

words.tran_cn: 不名誉的；无耻的；不受尊重的（等于dishonorable）
拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）

trans.tran_cn: 不名誉，耻辱，丢脸，丢脸的人或事
trans.tran_en: loss of respect from other people, because you have behaved in a morally unacceptable way

trans.tran_cn: 拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）
trans.tran_en: if a bank dishonours a cheque, it refuses to pay out money for it

trans.tran_cn: 使（人、家族等）丧失名誉，拒绝承兑（支票等），不履行（诺言等）
